title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
OB:
No children nodes are listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. The new data source has no database/table/column information.

Observed result: No children node listing when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
EB: The children should be listed when changing the data source. Expected result: When changing the data source, the new data source's children should be listed.
SR:
To reproduce:

1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Select a data source that does not have any database/table/column information.
3. Open the data set editor in the query tab.
4. Change the data source for the data set.
5. Check if the children nodes are listed.

Note: Close the data set editor and reopen it before checking if the children nodes are listed.
